title: Need help with pizza ordering program
author: t2_26fvpty2
text:
I got the first part completed but I am stuck on the second part does anyone know what the problem is?

https://pastebin.com/dbLpBsF1

comments.author: kyber
comments.body:
You do need to return a reference to an object you have created in a function, and you need to catch/consume it where you called it from otherwise Python will send the object to the great bit bucket.

Do not use *reserved* words like `type` as variable names.

You don't have a function `pizzatype()` but attempt to call it.

Using a `main()` function is pretty pointless. That's more useful if your code is going to offered as a module. A hangover from C/Java programming. Put the main logic where you've called `main()`.

I think you need to spend more time with pen and paper drawing the high level solution rather than working at the keyboard. Then write that up as pseudocode.

Some ideas:

    welcome()
    order = []
    while True:  # choosing from menu
        option = menu_pick()
        if not option:  # empty response to finish
            break
        toppings = []
        if option in pizzas:
            toppings = pizza_toppings(option)
        order.append((options, toppings))
    if order:
        paid = take_payment(order)
        if paid:
            completed = make_order(order)
        
        etc
